body_html: The context behind this is that there's a bug in nn.Embedding backward (and any backwards that returns sparse gradients) where if a gradient is a zero-filled sparse tensor (from using the padding_idx argument in nn.Embedding), accumulating gradients doesn't work because a zero-filled sparse tensor always has (dimI, dimV) = (tensor.dim(), 0) (See #7469).

body: The context behind this is that there's a bug in nn.Embedding backward (and any backwards that returns sparse gradients) where if a gradient is a zero-filled sparse tensor (from using the padding_idx argument in nn.Embedding), accumulating gradients doesn't work because a zero-filled sparse tensor always has `(dimI, dimV) = (tensor.dim(), 0)` (See #7469).
